intro: Benthamidia ferruginea, commonly known as the rust-leaf benthamidia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves with a reddish-brown underside. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its bark and leaves contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
